required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Evaluation of Genetron TERT PCR Kit in Glioma Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Evaluation of Genetron TERT PCR Kit in Glioma Patients

collaborator.agency: The First Hospital of Jilin University

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this trail is to evaluate the performance of Genetron TERT PCR Kit in Glioma patients using real-time PCR method.

detailed_description.textblock: This trial follows the principle of synchronous blinding. The enrolled cases are coded, and the enrolled samples are detected with the Genetron TERT PCR Kit and Sanger sequencing method. The results were determined independently according to the cutoff values or interpretation requirements provided by each method.Combined with the results of clinicopathological classification, the incidence of C228T and C250T mutations of TERT promoter genes in different subtypes was counted to evaluate the clinical application performance of the Genetron TERT PCR Kit.

primary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of the Genetron TERT PCR Kit
primary_outcome.description: The main purpose of this study is: by evaluating the Genetron TERT PCR Kit to compare the results of the Sanger sequencing method, and to calculate the coincidence rate and consistency of the two methods.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Enroll cases in strict accordance with the requirements of the study
2. The remaining samples after routine clinical testing
3. The collection and processing of samples meet the requirements of standard laboratory operations and product instructions
4. The relevant information of the sample is complete, including sample number, gender, age, and possible clinical diagnosis information
5. Each sample must have HE staining results (hematoxylin-eosin staining)
6. Pathological examination diagnosed as glioma, other brain tumors or normal tissues
7. Number of samples: 10 pieces of each sample with a thickness of 10Î¼m, and the tumor content is not less than 50%
Exclusion Criteria:
1. The sample information is not complete
2. Severely contaminated samples
3. Samples that do not meet the requirements of sample collection and processing

facility.name: The First Hospital of Jilin University
West China Hospital of Sichuan University
The Second Affiliated Hospital of Zhejiang University
